subject: Travel
title: Moroccan Tea Hospitality
description: A 60-second lesson on Moroccan Tea Hospitality.

hook.text: In Morocco, the host pours tea from three feet above the glass ‚Äî without spilling a drop.

buildup.text: Moroccan mint tea is poured high to create foam on top, which signals proper preparation.

discovery.text: You're always served three glasses. The proverb says: first is gentle, second is strong, third is sweet.

twist.text: Refusing tea is refusing friendship. Even in shops, merchants serve tea before any negotiation begins.

climax.text: The tea ritual can last over an hour. Rushing through it signals you don't value the relationship.

punchline.text: In Morocco, every deal starts with three cups of tea.

quiz.question: Why is Moroccan tea poured from a height?
